Data Quality:
The administrative shape files in this database are collected from Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS). Besides, the main source of information on soils and landforms are the reconnaissance soil survey reports published by the Soil Resources Development Institute (SRDI). 
SRDI created this survey data at 1: 50,000 scale by free hand digitization from Survey of Bangladesh’s Arial Photo map (spatial resolution of Arial Photo is 50 cm) height. Later they verified this data in the field. This process is followed to create soil polygon data. On the other hand, soil sample points data (soil chemical and physical properties data added as attributes to this point) are collected by using handheld GPS with an accuracy of (+-) 5 m. 
Later, BARC created GIS data from this upazila wise soil map of SRDI and matches upazila’s edges for whole country. Thus, this soil related GIS data is created through adding locational intelligence to it by BARC. BARC also performed spatial analysis on this spatially corrected data to create crop suitability maps.

Overview.Title: Data Product Specifications on Geospatial Database of BPDB
Overview.Objectives:
Geospatial Database of BPDB contains database of three categoryservices. The first one is for base map service which contains information about important feature (Hospital, Market, Bus Station etc.), structures and Land use of whole Bangladesh. The second category information is about Consumers. This service is responsible for showing connectivity from Feeder to Consumers which includes LT Poles, LT Feeder Lines, Service Points, Connectivity to Consumer Meters, Consumers. The third category contains general information. It contains general information of BPDB Regions and Electric Equipment. BPDB, who are responsible for providing uninterrupted quality power for whole Bangladesh, has developed and continuously updating this database for following purposes: 
• Engaging in implementation of the development program in power sector
• Adopting modern technology and ensure optimum utilization of the primary and alternative source
• Purchase power as a Single Buyer from power producers
• Provide reliable power supply to customers.

Overview.Title: Data Product Specifications on GIS data for Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) of DMTCL
Overview.Objectives:
Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) or Metrorail is a state-of-the-art public transport system capable of transporting more passengers together by rail for metropolitan and adjoining areas. MRT or Metrorail is a long-distance, safe, reliable, air-conditioned, time-efficient, electric and eco-friendly public transport consisting of elevated or underground or a combination of elevated and underground. Metrorail will play a major role in reducing traffic congestion in the densely populated metropolis, Dhaka. Metrorail stations are located at a distance of less than one kilometer, so the public can walk to the metro station within 500 (five hundred) meters of the station.
The government intends to build a strong network of 6 (six) metrorail lines in Dhaka metropolis and adjoining areas with a total length of 127.641 km (elevated 8.569 km and underground 61.162 km), 104 stations (elevated 51 and underground 53) and adopted a time bound action plan 2030.
Overview.Extent of the data: Six Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) or Metro Rail routes covering the distance of 127.641 Kilometers having 104 Stations in Dhaka city and its adjoining areas. However, as of 2021, the metro rail system of Dhaka consists of one line referred to as the MRT (Mass Rapid Transit) Line-6, with other metro rail lines going to be added in the future.

Data Quality:
The following procedure is practiced in DWASA for checking it’s data quality:

•	When data is provided by vendors or field staffs; a checking is done based on the omission or commission of the features. It is checked by comparing text report statistics and number of total features in the GIS data.
•	Furthermore, checking is done based on consumer’s data (i.e., How many consumers are there against how many meters location)
•	Finally, field checking is done using hardcopy map and measuring distance from nearby landmarks. (This nearby landmark based relative locationdistance is collected during the data collection phase which is checked in this final phase).

Data Quality:
SRDI created this survey data at 1: 50,000 scale by free hand digitization from Survey of Bangladesh’s Arial Photo map (spatial resolution Arial Photo is 50 cm) height. Later they verified this data in the field. This process is followed to create soil polygon data. The quality of the data is compromised due to hand digitization.
On the other hand, soil sample points data (soil chemical and physical properties data added as attributes to this point) are collected by using handheld GPS with an accuracy of (+-) 5 m.
SRDI will purchase Survey of Bangladesh’s data to enhance and add value to it’s Upazila soil maps.

Overview.Title: Data Product Specifications on National Water Resources Data of WARPO
Overview.Objectives: National Water Resources Database (NWRD) to meet the demand of consistent and corrected data and information from the planners, researchers and managers working in water sector. It is a mandate of WARPO to establish and update the National Water Resources Database (NWRD). The NWRD has become the largest geo-spatial database in the country, which holds spatial, temporal and attribute information on water resources. The NWRD is organized into data groups like Base Data, Surface water, Groundwater, Soil and Agriculture, Fisheries, Forest, Socio-economic, Meteorological, Documents and Reports, Environment and Image.
